[vc_row css=”.vc_custom_1578064109173{background-color: #f7f9fa !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column]

[vc_row_inner column_inner_spacing=”60″ css=”.vc_custom_1597333662574{background-color: #ffffff !important;}”][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″]

Take the next step

For more information about our systems, to purchase or to set up a meeting, talk to our local team.

American Ground Screw
512 Tuttle St. Des Moines, IA 50309
(833) 359-9475

Find Us on Map

Our Email
Click Here

[/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″]

Let's Talk About Your Project

After we get some information from you, we’ll set up a time to discuss your project in further detail.

Name(Required)
Address(Required)
What materials are you using that would be connected to the screw?
If you know the frost level of your project location, please type it here. Otherwise you may skip this question.
Do you need to pull a permit?(Required)
Yes - Since you plan to apply for a permit, I would start by asking your local code official if they will accept the use of ground screws. If they require it is building code approved or have additional questions, I would encourage you to share our ICC evaluation report(hyperlink) with them. American Ground Screw is the first company to have ground screws accepted into the building code, however, because it is such a new technology in the U.S. each jurisdiction views them differently. You can review the load capacities on page 11, table 5 to see if they meet your requirements.

No - American Ground Screw is the first company to have ground screws accepted into the building code, and the attached ESR documents that approval.  I understand you are not going to submit for a permit, but you can review the load capacities in the chart below to see if they meet your requirements.
Do you have access to a low-speed/high torque auger?(Required)
(Commercial-grade ground screws require low speed/high torque equipment to install.  We offer a hand-held electric driver as well as a machine-mounted hydraulic unit for sale and rent.  You can view them on our website under information/installation. 
Please enter a number from 9 to 9.
[/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner]
[/vc_column][/vc_row]
